Cut and Paste: To place article links in an external web document, simply copy and paste the HTML below, starting with "<a href"

To continue, in Internet Explorer, select FILE then SAVE AS from your browser's toolbar above. Be sure to save as a plain text file (.txt) or a 'Web Page, HTML only' file (.html). In FireFox, select FILE then SAVE FILE AS from your browser's toolbar above. In Chrome, select right click (with your mouse) on this page and select SAVE AS


Record: 1
Title:
Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Books (poetry, novels, novellas and short stories, drama, and literary criticism), film scenarios and collaborations, audio-visual material, radio work, and manuscripts; Audio-visual material
Other Title:
Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Books (poetry, novels, novellas and short stories, drama, and literary criticism), film scenarios and collaborations, audio-visual material, radio work, and manuscripts
Record Type:
Reference Series
Series Title:
Annotated bibliography of Canada's major authors, no. 7
Author(s):
Russell, D.W. (compiler)
Genre(s):
Bibliography
Subject(s):
Authors discussed:  HEBERT, Anne; HEBERT, Anne -- Bibliography
Topics:  CANADIAN literature -- Bibliography; FRENCH-CANADIAN literature -- Bibliography
Book Source:
Russell, D.W. (compiler) Part 1: Works By Anne Hebert.
Publisher Information: Toronto, Ontario : ECW Press, 1987. (pp. 117-145)
ISBN: 0920763111 (hardcover); 092076312X (paperback)

Accession Number:
ABCMA07AHP1000007002001007
Persistent link to this record (Permalink):

Cut and Paste:
<A href="https://lib-ezproxy.concordia.ca/login?url=https://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&db=cjh&AN=ABCMA07AHP1000007002001007&site=ehost-live&scope=site">Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Books (poetry, novels, novellas and short stories, drama, and literary criticism), film scenarios and collaborations, audio-visual material, radio work, and manuscripts; Audio-visual material</A>
Database:
Canadian Literary Centre

Source: Part 1: Works By Anne Hebert. Russell, D.W. (compiler); Toronto, Ontario : ECW Press, 1987, pp. 117-145

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Books (poetry, novels, novellas and short stories, drama, and literary criticism), film scenarios and collaborations, audio-visual material, radio work, and manuscripts; Audio-visual material  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

Audio-Visual Material

Note: This category includes the listing of radio plays by Hebert (even though no archival holdings of these broadcasts have been found) as well as stage and television productions of plays written for these media. Details for many of the unverified radio and television productions are drawn from "Anne Hebert: auteur," an unpublished bibliography by Paulette Caron and Daniel Lemieux, of the Secretariat des Relations Publiques, Society Radio-Canada, written in August 1981. Entries from the CBC Englishlanguage network have been verified in the CBC Archives, 90 Summach Street, Toronto.

A25      L'Etourderie. Trois de Quebec. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 28 oct. 1950.

A26      La Bouffonnerie. Trois de Quebec. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 11 nov. 1950.

A27      Les Prodiges. Trois de Quebec. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 18 nov. 1950.

A28      La Critique. Trois de Quebec. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 2 dec. 1950.

A29      Don Guichasse. Trois de Quebec. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 16 doc. 1950.

A30      Les Anges parmi nous: Conte de Noel. Trois de Quebec. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 23 doc. 1950.

A31      Autour des Rois mages. Trois de Quebec. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 6 jan. 1951.

A32      Conte de l'an 2000. Trois de Quebec. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 20 jan. 1951.

A33      La Rilussite. Trois de Quebec. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 27 jan. 1951.

A34      L'Honneur. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 20 oct. 1951.

A35      L'Inquidtude. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 3 nov. 1951.

A36      La Cruante. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 17 nov. 1951.

A37      L'Imposteur. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 1 dec. 1951.

A38      Les Convictions. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 15 dec. 1951.

A39      La Grandeur. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 12 jan. 1952.

A40      Le Bonheur. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 26 jan. 1952.

A41      Les Sentiments. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 9 fev. 1952.

A42      La Foi. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 23 fev. 1952.

A43      L'Enchantement A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 26 avril 1952.

A44      La Liberte. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 10 mai 1952.

A45      L'Heritage. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 24 mai 1952.

A46      Le Voyage. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 7 juin 1952.

A47      Les Classes sociales. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 28 juin 1952.

A48      La Chose publique. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 5 juil. 1952.

A49      La Solitude. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 19 juil. 1952.

A50      Les Invitils au proces. Prod. and dir. Guy Beauine. Le Theatre du grand prix. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 20 juil. 1952. See Ts.Ma.Ip.

A51      La Terre. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 2 aout 1952.

A52      Le Talent. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 30 aout 1952.

A53      L'Art de plaire. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 13 sept. 1952.

A54      Le Jeu. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 27 sept. 1952.

A55      La Civilisation. A travers le temps. Prod. and dir. Paul Legendre. CBC Radio/Radio-Canada, 16 oct. 1952.

A56      Le Temps sauvage. Dir. Albert Millaire. Prod. Theatre du Nouveau-Monde. Palais Montcalm, Quebec, 8 oct. 1966.

            Le Temps sauvage. Dir. Albert Millaire. Prod. Theatre du Nouveau-Monde. Comedie     Canadienne, Montreal, 10-16 oct. 1966.

A57      Kamouraska. Narr. Danielle Nault. Le Livre parlant. Montreal: INCA, 1976. (6 cassettes; 9 hr.)

            Kamouraska. Trans. N. Shapiro. Narr. Catherine Crowell. Talking Books. Toronto: CNIB, 1977. (Cassette; 7 hr., 30 rain.)

            Kamouraska. Trans. Norman Shapiro. Narr. Catherine Crowell. Crane Memorial Library, Univ. of British Columbia, [c. 1984]. (2 cassettes; 4-track; 6 hr., 50 min.)

            Kamouraska. Narr. Alain Neuman. Crane Memorial Library, Univ. of British Columbia, n.d. (2 cassettes.)

            Kamouraska. Trans. Norman Shapiro. Narr. Catherine Crowell. Crane Memorial Library, Univ. of British Columbia, n.d. (5 cassettes.)

A58      Les Chambres de bois. Narr. Danielle Nault. Le Livre parlant. Montreal: INCA, 1979. (Cassette; 3 hr.)

            Les Chambres de bois. Narr. Danielle Nault. Le Livre parlant. Toronto: CNIB, 1979. The Silent Rooms. Trans. Kathy Mezei. Narr. Linda Goranson. Talking Books. Toronto: CNIB, 1979. (1 cassette; 2 hr., 30 min.)

            Les Chambres de bois. Trans. Kathy Mezei. Narr. John Stout. Crane Memorial Library, Univ. of British Columbia, [c. 1980]. (2 cassettes.)

            Les Chambres de bois. Narr. Francoise Charest. Crane Memorial Library, Univ. of British Columbia, n.d. (5 cassettes.)

A59      Les Enfants du sabbat. Narr. Jacques Pipperni. Le livre parlant. Montreal: INCA, 1979. (Cassette; 5 hr., 20 min.)

            Children of the Black Sabbath. Trans. Carol Dunlop-Hebert. Narr. Elise Goldsmith. Talking Books. Toronto: CNIB, [c.1982]. (1 cassette; 4 track; 5 hr., 35 min.)

            Les Enfants du sabbat. Narr. Francoise Charest. Crane Memorial Library, Univ. of British Columbia, n.d. (5 cassettes.)

A60      Le Torrent. Narr. Daniel Simard. Le Livre parlant. Montreal: INCA, [c. 1979]. (4 cassettes.)

            The Torrent: Novellas and Short Stories. Trans. Gwendolyn Moore. Narr. Elise Goldsmith. Talking Books. Toronto: CNIB, 1982. (4 cassettes; 6 hr.)

            The Torrent: Novellas and Short Stories. Trans. Gwendolyn Moore. Narr. Elise Goldsmith. Talking Books. Toronto: CNIB, [c. 1982]. (1 cassette; 4-track; 4 hr., 30 min.)

            The Torrent: Novellas and Short Stories. Trans. Gwendolyn Moore. Narr. Sandra Harper. Crane Memorial Library, Univ. of British Columbia, n.d. (3 cassettes.) Includes "The Torrent," "The Coral Frock," "Springtime for Catherine," "The House on Esplanade," "A Grand Marriage," and "The Death of Stella."

            The Torrent. Trans. Gwendolyn Moore. Narr. Catherine Crowell. Crane Memorial Library, Univ. of British Columbia, n.d. (Reel-to-reel tape; 1 hr.) Includes "The Torrent."

A61      Heloise. Narr. Louise Ladouceur. Le Livre parlant. Toronto: CNIB, 1980. (Cassette; 2 hr.)

A62      Poems. Trans. Alan Brown. Narr. Valerie Gibson. Crane Memorial Library, Univ. of British Columbia, n.d. (1 cassette.)

A63      Les Temps sauvage. La Merciere assassinee. Les Invites au proces. Narr. Francoise Charest. Crane Memorial Library, Univ. of British Columbia, n.d. (6 cassettes.)

Drama

A10     Le Temps sauvage. La Merciere assassinee. Les Invites au proces. Theatre Collection l'arbre, G-2. Montreal: HMH, 1967. 187 pp. Includes Le Temps sauvage (B146), La Merciere assassinee (B145), and Les Invites au proces.

Database:
Canadian Literary Centre

Source: Part 1: Works By Anne Hebert. Russell, D.W. (compiler); Toronto, Ontario : ECW Press, 1987, pp. 117-145

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Books (poetry, novels, novellas and short stories, drama, and literary criticism), film scenarios and collaborations, audio-visual material, radio work, and manuscripts; Film scenarios and collaborations  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

Film Scenarios and Collaborations

Note: This listing includes all the films on which Hebert collaborated at the Office national du film, for which she wrote either the scenario or the commentary. Many of these films have since been withdrawn from circulation by the ONF.

A12     Scenario. La Femme de menage. Silhouette canadienne. Prod. and dir. Leonard Forest. Office national du film, 1954. (16 mm.; 11 min.)

A13     Scenario. La Canne piche. Prod. Leonard Forest. Dir. Fernand Dansereau. Office national du film, 1959. (16 mm.; 29 min., 30 sec.)

A14     Scenario. Saint-Denys Garneau. Prod. Leonard Forest. Dir. Jean Dansereau and Bernard Bosselin. Decoupage Louis Portugais. Office national du film, 1960, (16 mm.; 21 min., 23 sec.)

A15     Commentary. Le Cocher. Office national du film, 1953. (16 mm.; 8 min.)

A16     Commentary. L'Eclusier. Office national du film, 1953. (16 mm.; 8 min.)

A17     Commentary. Le Photographe. Office national du film, 1953. (16 mm.; 8 min.)

A18     Commentary. Midinette. Office national du film, 1954. (16 mm.; 19 min.)

A19     Commentary. Pocheurs de Terre-Neuve. Prod. Nicholas Balla. Dir. Jacques Bobet. Office national du film, 1954. (16 mm.; 21 min.) A French version of High Tide of Newfoundland. Prod. Nicholas Balla. Dir. Grant McLean. National Film Board, 1953. (16 mm.; 21 min.)

A20     Commentary. Drele de Micmac. Prod. Collin Low. Office national du film, 1954. (16 mm.; 15 min., 42 sec.) A French version of Traffic Hazards. Prod. Colin Low. Dir. Tom Daly. National Film Board, 1953. (16 mm.; 15 min., 42 sec.)

A21     Commentary. Les Indes parminous. Prod. Nicholas Balla. Dir. Jacques Bobet. Office national du film, 1954. (16 mm.; 15 min.)

A22     Commentary. Le Medecin du nord. Prod. and dir. Jean Palardy. Office national du film 1954. (16 mm.; 21 min., 30 sec.)

A23     Commentary. Le Deficient mental. Prod. Leonard Forest. Dir. Jean Roy. Office national du film, 1960. (16 mm.; 29 min., 12 sec.)

A24     Hebert, Anne, and Claude Jutra, adapted. Kamouraska. Dir. Claude Jutra. Prod. Productions Carllamy. Criterion Pictures, 1973. (35 mm.; 119 min.) Based on the novel Kamouraska. The cast includes Genevieve Bujold, Richard Jordan, and Philippe Leonard.

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Books (poetry, novels, novellas and short stories, drama, and literary criticism), film scenarios and collaborations, audio-visual material, radio work, and manuscripts; Literary criticism  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

Literary Criticism

A11     Hebert, Anne, and Frank Scott. Foreword/Preface Northrop Frye. Trans. Jean Simard. Introd. Jeanne Lapointe. Dialogue sur la traduction: a propos du "Tombeau des rois." Collection sur parole. Montreal: HMH, 1970. 5-35, 109 pp. Includes "Dialogue" (B152).

Cut and Paste:
<A href="https://lib-ezproxy.concordia.ca/login?url=https://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&db=cjh&AN=ABCMA07AHP1000007002001009&site=ehost-live&scope=site">Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Books (poetry, novels, novellas and short stories, drama, and literary criticism), film scenarios and collaborations, audio-visual material, radio work, and manuscripts; Manuscripts</A>
Database:
Canadian Literary Centre

Source: Part 1: Works By Anne Hebert. Russell, D.W. (compiler); Toronto, Ontario : ECW Press, 1987, pp. 117-145

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Books (poetry, novels, novellas and short stories, drama, and literary criticism), film scenarios and collaborations, audio-visual material, radio work, and manuscripts; Manuscripts  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

Manuscripts

A66     National Film Board Records Centre/Office national du film, Centre des Documents, 6155 Cite de Liesse, Montreal, Quebec. The archives hold film scenarios and commentaries written by Hebert for La Canned peche (3 pp., ts), Le Cocher (2 pp., ts), Le Deficient mental (3 pp., ts), Drole de Micmac (5 pp., ts), L'Eclusier (2 pp., ts), La Femme de menage (2 pp., ts, and 16 pp., ts), Les Indes parmi nous (3 pp., ts), Le Medecin du nord (3 pp., ts), Midinette (4 pp., ts), Pecheurs de Terre-Neuve (3 pp., ts), Le Photographe (2 pp., ts), and Saint-Denys Garneau (24 pp., ts, and 16 pp. ts).

A67     CBC/Radio-Canada Archives, 1400 Boulevard Dorchester est, Montreal, Quebec. The archives hold tss of Les Invitee au proces and La Merciere assassinee.

A68     Centre documentaire des lettres canadiennes-francaises, Department d'etudes francaises, University de Montreal, Montreal, Quebec. The archives hold "L'Arche de midi."

A69     Centre de recherche en civilisation canadienne-francaise, University d'Ottawa Ottawa, Ontario. The archives hold "L'Arche de midi."

A70     The Macmillan Company of Canada Archives, Mills Memorial Library, Hamilton, Ontario The Macmillan archives at McMaster contain author correspondence about Le Torrent (1962).

Database:
Canadian Literary Centre

Source: Part 1: Works By Anne Hebert. Russell, D.W. (compiler); Toronto, Ontario : ECW Press, 1987, pp. 117-145

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Books (poetry, novels, novellas and short stories, drama, and literary criticism), film scenarios and collaborations, audio-visual material, radio work, and manuscripts; Novels  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

Novels

A4      Les Chambres de bois. Preface Samuel S. de Sacy. Paris: Seuil, 1958. 9-24, 190 pp.

        The Silent Rooms. Trans. Kathy Mezei. Toronto: Musson, 1974. 167 pp.

           Les Chambres de bois. Trans. Kathy Mezei. Toronto: General, 1975. 167 pp.

           Les Chambres de bois. Preface Samuel S. de Sacy. Paris: Seuil, 1979. 9-24, 190 pp.

A5      Kamouraska. Paris: Seuil, 1970. 250 pp.

           Suuri Rakkaus. Trans. Matti Brotherus. Helsinki: Kirjayhtymui, and Jyvasklyla: K-J. Gummerus, 1971. 212 pp.

           A Mascara da inoconcia Trans. Leonidas Gontijo de Carvalho. Rio: Civilizacao Brasikira, 1972. 248 pp.

           Dietro il gelo dei vetri. Trans. Dianella Selvatico Estense. Milano: Arnoldo Mondadori, 1972. 265 pp.

           Kamouraska. Trans. Gertrud Strub. Frankfurt: Bucher, 1972. 269 pp.

           Kamouraska. Trans. Gertrud Strub. Lucerne: Bucher, 1972. 270 pp.

           Kamuraska. Trans. J. Maria Martinez Monasterio. Barcelona: Plaza & Janis, 1972. 250 pp.

           Kamouraska. Trans. Norman Shapiro. New York: Crown, 1973. 250 pp.

           Kamouraska. Paris: Seuil, [1973]. 250 pp.

           Kamouraska. Trans. Norman Shapiro. Toronto: Musson, 1973. 250 pp.

           Kamouraska. Trans. Norman Shapiro. Toronto: PaperJacks, 1974. 250 pp.

           Kao no ue no kiri no aft. Trans. Asabuki Yukiko. Tokyo: Kodansha, 1976. 267 pp.

           Kamouraska. Illus. Antoine Dumas. Montreal: Art global, 1977. 271 pp.

           Kamouraska. Trans. and Afterword Eva Janovcovei. Prague: Odeon, 1977. 269 pp.

           Kamouraska. Collection Points, Serie Roman, No. R67. Paris: Seuil, [1982]. 250 pp.

           Kamouraska. Trans. Norman Shapiro. New Press Canadian Classics. Toronto: General, 1982. 250 pp.

           Kamouraska. Trans. Lucia Gogan. Bucharest: Univers, 1986.

A6      Les Enfants du sabbat. Paris: Seuil, 1975. 189 pp.

           Children of the Black Sabbath. Trans. Carol Dunlop-Hebert. New York: Crown, 1977. 198 pp.

           Les Enfants du sabbat. Trans. Carol Dunlop-Hebert. Toronto: Musson, 1977. 198 pp.

           Les Enfants du sabbat. Trans. Carol Dunlop-Hebert. Toronto: PaperJacks, 1978. 198 pp.

           Les Enfants du sabbat. Collection Points, Serie Roman, No. R117. Paris: Seuil, [1983]. 189 pp.

A7      Heloise. Paris: Seuil, 1980. 124 pp.

           Heloise. Trans. Sheila Fischman. Toronto: Stoddart, 1982. 101 pp.

           Heloise. Trans. Sheila Fischman. New Press Canadian Classics. Toronto: General, 1983. 89 pp.

A8      Les Fous de Bassan. Paris: Seuil, 1982. 249 pp. Paris: France Loisirs, [1983]. 228 pp.

           In the Shadow of the Wind. Trans. Sheila Fischman. Don Mills, Ont.: Stoddart, 1983. 184 pp.

           Les Fous de Bassan. Collection Points, Serie Roman, No. R141. Paris: Seuil, [1984]. 249 pp.

           In the Shadow of the Wind. London: Dent, 1984. 184 pp.

           Havet var Iugnt. Trans. Karin Nyman. Malmo, Sweden: Berghs, 1985.

Database:
Canadian Literary Centre

Source: Part 1: Works By Anne Hebert. Russell, D.W. (compiler); Toronto, Ontario : ECW Press, 1987, pp. 117-145

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Books (poetry, novels, novellas and short stories, drama, and literary criticism), film scenarios and collaborations, audio-visual material, radio work, and manuscripts; Novellas and short stories  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

Novellas and Short Stories

A9     Le Torrent. Montreal: Beauchemin, 1950. 171 pp. Includes "L'Ange de Dominique" (B71), "La Maison de l'esplanade" (B69-B70), "Le Printemps de Catherine," "La Robe corail," and "Le Torrent" (B72).

          Le Torrent suivi de deux nouvelles inedites. Collection l'arbre, 1. Montreal: HMH, 1963. 248 pp. Includes "L'Ange de Dominique" (B71), "Un grand mariage" (B74), "La Maison de l'esplanade" (B69-B70), "La Mort de Stella," "Le Printemps de Catherine," "La Robe corail," and "Le Torrent" (B72).

          Le Torrent. Paris: Seuil, 1965. 206 pp. Includes "La Maison de resplanade" (B69-B70), "La Mort de Stella," "Le Printemps de Catherine," "La Robe corail," "Le Torrent" (B72), and "Un grand mariage" (B74).

          The Torrent: Novellas and Short Stories. Trans. Gwendolyn Moore. French Writers of Canada. Montreal: Harvest House, 1973. 134 pp. Includes "The Coral Frock," "The Death of Stella," "A Grand Marriage" (B74), "The House on the Esplanade" (B69-B70), "Springtime for Catherine," and "The Torrent" (B72).

          Le Torrent. nouvelles. Collection l'arbre. Montreal: HMH, 1976. 173 pp. Reset impression of the 1963 edition.

Title:

Database:
Canadian Literary Centre

Source: Part 1: Works By Anne Hebert. Russell, D.W. (compiler); Toronto, Ontario : ECW Press, 1987, pp. 117-145

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Books (poetry, novels, novellas and short stories, drama, and literary criticism), film scenarios and collaborations, audio-visual material, radio work, and manuscripts; Poetry  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

Anne Hebert

An Annotated Bibliography

[underbar]

D. W. Russell

Part 1

Works by Anne Hebert

[underbar]

A      Books (Poetry, Novels, Novellas and Short Stories, Drama, and Literary Criticism), Film Scenarios and Collaborations, Audio-Visual Material, Radio Work, and Manuscripts

Poetry

A1     Les Songes en equilibre. Montreal: l'Arbre, 1942. 156 pp. Includes "Berceuse lente," "Le Carrousel," "La Chambre d'enfant," "Chats" (B18), "Communion," "Danse" (B2), "Les Deux Mains" (B4), "Devant le crucifix," "L'Eau" (B25), "Emmanuelle," "Espace" (B7) "Eternite," "Eve [Commencement du monde ...]" (B8), "Fantasmagories," "Figure de proue," "Fontaine," "Image dans un miroir," "Instant," "Jardin de fievre," "Jour de juin" (B5), "Ma belle reverie," "Ma douleur," "Maman," "Marine" (B6), "Minuit," "Le Miroir" (B3), "Mort," "Musique" (B9), "L'Oiseau du porte," "O mes joies enfantines," "Pentecote," "Poeme pour papa," "Premiere Station," "Priere," "La Sainte Vierge m'a parle," "Sainte Vierge Marie," "Six Petits Poemes pour la Semaine sainte: I [Voici le premier jour...], II [Apres Bethanie...] [B10], III [Voici venir le Vendredi Saint...], IV [Dire que nous etions presents...], V [Jesus est mis au tombeau ...], VI ['Alleluia! Alleluia! ...']," "Soir," "Sous la pluie" (B1), "Sur une valse de Ravel," "Tableau de grave" (B29), "Terre," "Therise de l'Enfant Jesus," and "Le Vent."

A2     Le Tombeau des rois. Preface Pierre Emmanuel. Quebec: Institut litteraire du Quebec, 1953. 76 pp. Includes "La Chambre de bois," "La Chambre fermie" (B39), "De plus en plus Detroit," "En guise de fete" (B31), "L'Envers du monde" (B36), "Eveil au seuil d'une fontaine" (Bll), "La Fille maigre" (B32), "Les Grandes Fontaines," "II y a certainement quelqu'un" (B47), "Inventaire," "Les Mains" (B44), "Nos mains au jardin" (B54), "Nuit" (B60), "Paysage," "Les Pecheurs d'eau" (B33), "Petit Desespoir' (B45), "Les Petites Villes" (B21), "Retourne sur tes pas," "Rouler dans des ravins de fatigue," "Sous la pluie" (B1), "Le Tombeau des rois" (B35), "Un bruit de soie," "Un mur peine," "Une petite morte" (B53), "Vie de chateau" (B34), "Vieille Image" (B55), and "La Voix de l'oiseau" (B30). The Tomb of the Kings. Trans. Peter Miller. "Translator's Note" Peter Miller. Preface Pierre Emmanuel. Toronto: Contact, 1967. 11-12, 13, 91 pp. French with facing-page English translations. Includes "La Chambre de bois/The Wooden Room," "La Chambre fermee/The Closed Room" (B39), "De plus en plus etroit/Narrower and Narrower," "En guise de fate/By Way of Holiday/' (B31), "L'Envers du monde/The Other Side of the World" (B36), "Eveil au seuil d'une fontaine/Awakening at the Edge of a Fountain" (B11), "La Fille maigre/The Thin Girl" (B32), "Les Grandes Fontaines/The Great Fountains," "Il y a certainement quelqu'un/There Is Certainly Someone" (B47), "Inventaire/Inventory" "Les Mains/The Hands" (B44), "Nos mains au jardin/Our Hands in the Garden" (B54), "Nuit/Night" (B60), "Paysage/Landscape" "Les Picheurs d'eau/The Water Fishermen" (B33), "Petit Desespoir/Little Despair" (B45), "Les Petites Villes/The Little Towns" (B21), "Retourne sur tes pas/Retrace Your Steps," "Rouler dans des ravins de fatigue/Rolling in the Ravines of Fatigue," "Sous la pluie/Under the Rain" (B1), "Le Tombeau des rois/The Tomb of the Kings" (B35), "Un bruit de soie/A Sound of Silk," "Un mur a peine/Hardly a Wall," "Une petite morte/A Little Corpse" (B53), "Vie de chateau/Mansion Life" (B34), "Vieille Image/Old Image" (B55), and "La Voix de l'oiseau/The Voice of the Birds" (B30).

A3     Poemes. Preface Pierre Emmanuel. Paris: Seuil, 1960. 11-12, 110 pp. Includes the following poems under the subheading Le Tombeau des rois: "La Chambre de bois" (A2), "La Chambre fermie" (B39), "De plus en plus detroit" (A2), "En guise de fete" (B31), "L'Envers du monde" (B36), "Eveil au seuil d'une fontaine" (B11), "La Fille maigre" (B32), "Les Grandes Fontaines" (A2), "Il y a certainement quelqu'un" (B47), "Inventaire" (A2), "Les Mains" (B44), "Nos mains au jardin" (B54), "Nuit" (B60), "Paysage" (A2), "Les Pocheurs d'eau" (B33), "Petit Desespoire" (B45), "Les Petites Villes" (B21), "Retourne sur tes pas" (A2), "Rouler dans des ravins de fatigue" (A2), "Sous la pluie" (B1), "Le Tombeau des rois" (B35), "Un bruit de soie" (A2), "Un mur peine" (A2), "Une petite morte" (B53), "Vie de chateau" (B34), "Vieille Image" (B55), "La Voix de l'oiseau" (B30). Includes the following poems under the subheading Mystere de la parole: "Alchimie du jour" (B38), "Annociation" "De grandes vertus brutes," "Des dieux captifs," "Eve [Reine et maitresse certaine crucifie aux portes de la ville la plus lointaine ...]" (B59), "Jesuis la terre et reau" (B40), "Mystere de la parole," "Naissance du pain" (B37), "Neige" (B41), "Printemps sur la ville," "La sagesse m'a rompu les bras," "Saison aveugle" (B42), "Survienne la rose des vents" (B43), "Trop a l'etroit," and "La Ville tuee." Also includes the essay "Poesie, solitude rompue" (B61). Poems by Anne Hebert. Trans. Alan Brown. Toronto: Musson, 1975. 76 pp. Includes the following poems under the subheading The Tomb of the Kings: "Barely a Wall" (A2; "Un mur a peine/Hardly a Wall"), "The Closed Room" (B39), "Dusty Image" (B55), "The Great Fountains" (A2; "Les Grandes Fontaines/ The Great Fountains"), "Hands" (B44), "In the Rain" (B1), "Inventory" (A2; "Inventaire/ Inventory"), "A Kind of Feast" (B31), "Landscape" (A2; "Paysage/Landscape"), "Life in the Castle" (B34), "Narrowing" (A2; "De plus en plus detroit/Narrower and Narrower"), "Night" (B60), "Our Hands in the Garden" (B54), "A Small Dead Girl" (B53), "A Small Despair" (B45), "The Small Towns" (B21), "A Sound of Silk" (A2; "Un bruit de soie/A Sound of Silk"), "There Is Surely Someone" (B47), "Thin Girl" (B32), "Tomb of the Kings" (B35), "Tumbling in Ravines of Weariness" (A2; "Rouler dans des ravins de fatigue/Rolling in the Ravines of Fatigue"), "Turn Back," "The Voice of the Bird" (B30), "Waking at a Fountain's Rim" (B11), "Watery Fishermen" (B33), "The Wooden Room" (A2; "La Chambre de bois/The Wooden Room"), and "The World's Other Side" (B36). Includes the following poems under the subheading Mystery of the Verb: "Alchemy of the Day" (B38), "Annunciation" "The Birth of Bread" (B37), "Blind Season" (B42), "Captive Gods," "Eve [Queen and certain mistress crucified on the gates of the farthest city ...]" (B59), "Great Raw Virtues," "I Am the Earth the Water" (B40), "The Murdered City," "Mystery of the Verb," "Snow" (B41), "Spring Over the City," "Too Tightly Fitted," "The Windrose Appears" (B43), and "Wisdom Broke My Arm." Also includes the essay "Poetry Broken Solitude" (B61). Poems [Quarterly Review of Literature: Poetry Series, [2], 21, Nos.3-4 (1980), Pt. V]. Trans. and Afterward A. Poulin, Jr. 58-60, 60 pp. Includes the following poems under the heading The Tomb of the Kings: "Castle Life" (B34), "The Closed Room" (B39), "Hands" (B44), "Inventory," (A2), "Inventaire/Inventory"), "Minor Despair" (B45), "Mock Celebration" (B31), "More and More Narrow" (A2), "De plus en plus detroit Narrower and Narrower"), "Night" (B60), "Old Picture" (B55), "Our Hands in the Garden" (B54), "Small Dead Girl" (B53), "Small Towns" (B21), "Surely Someone" (B47), "The Thin Girl" (B32), "The Tomb of the Kings" (B35), "Waking at the Foot of a Fountain" (B11), "A Wall" (A2; "Un mur a peine/Hardly a Wall"), "The Watery Fisherman" (B33), and "The Wooden Room" (A2; "La Chambre de bois/The Wooden Room"). Includes the following poems under the heading The Mystery of the Word: "The Alchemy of Day" (B38), "Annunciation," "The Birth of Bread" (B37), "Blind Season" (B42), "Captive Gods," "Eve [Absolute queen and mistress crucified at the gates of the farthest city ...]" (B59), "Great Brute Virtues," "I Am Earth and Water" (B40), "If the Windrose" (B43), "The Murdered City," "Mystery of the Word," "Too Cramped," and "Wisdom Broke My Arms."

Title:

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Books (poetry, novels, novellas and short stories, drama, and literary criticism), film scenarios and collaborations, audio-visual material, radio work, and manuscripts; Radio work  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

Radio Work

A64      Freelance writer, Radio-Canada, 1950-53.

A65      Scanariste and freelance writer, NFB, 1953-60.

Database:
Canadian Literary Centre

Source: Part 1: Works By Anne Hebert. Russell, D.W. (compiler); Toronto, Ontario : ECW Press, 1987, pp. 117-145

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Contributions to periodicals and books (poems, short stories, excerpts and serials, reprinted anthology contributions: A selection, plays, essays, children's stories and plays, and journalism) and audio-visual material; Poems  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

B      Contributions to Periodicals and Books (Poems, Short Stories, Excerpts and Serials, Reprinted Anthology Contributions: A Selection, Plays, Essays, Children's Stories and Plays, and Journalism) and Audio-Visual Material

Note: When an item is reprinted in one of Hebert's books, this fact is noted in the entry through the following abbreviations: 

     
 Les Chambres de bois ........................... Cb
 Dialogue sur la traduction: propos du 
        "Tombeau des rois" .................... Dst
 Les Enfants du sabbat .......................... Es
 Les Fous de Bassan ............................. FB
 Heloise ....................................... Hel.
 Kamouraska .................................... Kam.
 Poemes ...................................... Poemes
 Poemes [Quarterly Review of Literature: Poetry 
    Series, [2], 21, Nos. 3-4 (1980)].........P[QRL]
 Poems by Anne Hebert ........................... PAH
 Les Songes en equilibre ......................... Se
 Le Temps sauvage. La Merciere assassinee. 
      Les Invitis au proces ................Ts.Ma.Ip
 The Tomb of the Kings ........................... TK
 Le Tombeau des rois ............................. Tr
 Le Torrent ..................................... Tor
 The Torrent: Novellas and Short Stories ...... T:NSS

Poems

B1      "Sous la pluie." Le Canada francais, 26 (avril 1939), 774-75. Se; Tr; TK ("Sous la pluie/Under the Rain"); Poemes ("Sous la pluie"); PAH ("In the Rain").

B2      "Danse." Le Canada francais, 27 (oct. 1939), 117-20. Se.

B3      "Le Miroir." La Revue populaire, fev. 1940, p. 15. Se.

B4      "Les Deux Mains." La Relive, 5 (mars 1941), 175-76. Rpt. trans. F.R. Scott ("The Two Hands") in The Tamarack Review, No.7 (Spring 1958), pp.46-47. Rpt. ("Les Deux Mains") in St Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, p.42. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott ("The Two Hands") in StDenys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, p.43. Rpt. ("Les Deux Mains") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hilbert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, p.42. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott (revised -- "The Two Hands") in StDenys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, p. 43. Se ("Les Deux Mains"). See B188 ("The Two Hands").

B5      "Jour de juin." La Relive, 5 (mars 1941), 177-79. Se.

B6      "Marine." La Releve, 5 (mars 1941), 174-75. Se.

B7      "Espace." Amerique francaise, 1, No.3 (fev. 1942), 8-9. Se.

B8      "Eve [Commencement du monde, ...]." Amerique francaise, 1, No. 3 (fev. 1942), 10-12. Se.

B9      "Musique." Amerique francaise, 1, No.3 (fev. 1942), 6-7. Se.

B10     "Jeudi-Saint." Paysana, avril 1942, p.9. Se ("Six Petits Poemes pour la Semaine sainte: II [Apres Bethanie...]").

B11     "Eveil au seuil d'une fontaine." Amerique francaise, 2, No. 2 (oct. 1942), 35. Tr; TK ("Eveil au seuil d'une Fontaine/Awakening at the Edge of a Fountain"); Poemes ("Eveil au seuil d'une fontaine"); PAH ("Wakening at the Fountain's Rim"); P[QRL] (revised -- "Waking at the Foot of a Fountain"). See B183 ("Poetry from French Canada: 'Eveil au seuil d'une fontaine'").

B12     "L'Esclave noire." Amorique francaise, 2, No.6 (mars 1943), 41-42.

B13     "Paradis perdu." Amorique francaise, 3, No.19 (fev. 1944), 31-32.

B14     "Prelude a la nuit." La Nouvelle Relive, 3 (mai 1944), 209.

B15     "Aube." Gants du ciel, No. 4 (juin 1944), pp. 6-7.

B16     "Ballade d'un enfant qui va mourir." Gants du ciel, No. 4 (juin 1944), pp. 16-20.

B17     "Le Chateau noir." Gants du ciel, No.4 (juin 1944), pp. 15-16.

B18     "Chats." Gants du ciel, No.4 (juin 1944), pp. 11-12. Se.

B19     "L'Infante ne danse plus." Gants du ciel, No.4 (juin 1944), pp. 5-6.

B20     "Je voudrais un havre de grace." Gants du ciel, No. 4 (juin 1944), pp. 13-14.

B21     "Les Petites Villes." Gants du ciel, No.4 (juin 1944), pp. 7-8. Rpt. trans. John Glassco in The Canadian Forum, Oct. 1959, p. 161. Tr; TK ("Les Petites Villes/The Little Towns"); Poemes ("Les Petites Villes"); PAH ("The Small Towns"); P[QRL] (revised -- "Small Towns"). See B176 ("Les Petites Villes").

B22     "Presence." Gants du ciel, No.4 (juin 1944), pp.12-13.

B23     "Sous-bois driver." Gants du ciel, No.4 (juin 1944), pp. 8-10.

B24     "Plenitude" Amerique francaise, oct. 1944, p.33.

B25     "Water." Trans. Leo Cox. Canadian Poetry Magazine, 8, No.2 (Dec. 1944), 19-21. Se ("L'Eau").

B26     "Resurrection de Lazare." La Revue dominicaine, mai 1945, pp. 257-58.

B27     "Offrande." La Revue dominicaine, juin 1946, pp. 321-22.

B28     "O beauty." La Revue dominicaine, jan. 1947, pp. 3-4.

B29     "Beach Tableau." Trans. Leo Cox. Canadian Poetry Magazine, 11, No. 2 (Dec. 1947), 20-21. Rpt. in Canadian Poetry Magazine, 20, No.3 (Spring 1957), 22-23. Se ('Tableau de grave").

B30     "La Voix de roiseau." La Revue dominicaine, jan. 1949, p.3. Tr; TK ("La Voix de l'oiseau/The Voice of the Birds"); Poemes ("La Voix de l'oiseau"); PAH ("The Voice of the Bird").

B31     "En guise de fite." Cite libre, 1, No. 3 (mai 1951), 25. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott ("As if for a Holiday") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Kianak, 1962, p. 35. Rpt. ("En guise de fete") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, p.34. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott ("As if for a Holiday") in StDenys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, p.35. Rpt. ("En guise de fete") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, p.34. Tr; TK ("En guise de fete/By Way of Holiday"); Poemes ("En guise de fete"); PAH ("A Kind of Feast"); P[QRL] (revised -- "Mock Celebration"). See B186 ("As if for a Holiday").

B32     "La Fille maigre." Cite libre, 1, No.3 (mai 1951), 26. Rpt. in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, p.32. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott ("The Lean Girl") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, p.33. Rpt. ("La Fille maigre") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, p. 32. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott ("The Thin Girl") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, p.33. Tr ("La Fille Maigre"); TK ("La Fille maigre/The Thin Girl"); Poemes ("La Fille maigre"); PAH ("Thin Girl"); P[QRL] (revised -- "The Thin Girl"). See B174 ("La Fille maigre").

B33     "Les Pecheurs d'eau." La Nouvelle Revue canadienne, 1, No.5 (nov.-doc. 1951), 12. Tr; TK ("Les Pecheurs d'eau/The Water Fishermen"); Poemes ("Les Pecheurs d'eau"); PAH ("Watery Fishermen"); P[QRL] (revised -- "The Watery Fishermen").

B34     "Vie de chateau." La Nouvelle Revue canadienne, 1, No. 5 (nov.-doc. 1951), 11. Rpt. in Cite libre, 2, Nos. 1-2 (juin-juil. 1952), 45. Rpt. trans. John Glassco in The Canadian Forum, Oct. 1959, p. 160. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott ("Manor Life") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, p.37. Rpt. ("Vie de chateau") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, p.36. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott (revised -- "Manor Life") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, p.37. Rpt. ("Vie de chateau") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, p.36. Tr; TK ("Vie de chateau/Mansion Life"); Poemes ("Vie de chateau"); PAH ("Life in the Castle"); P[QRL] (revised "Castle Life"). See B178 ("Vie de chateau").

B35     "Le Tombeau des rois." Cite libre, 1, No.4 (doc. 1951), 27-28. Rpt. in Esprit, NS 20, Pt.2, No.10, [No.195] (oct. 1952), 443-44. Rpt. trans. John Glassco in The Canadian Forum, Oct. 1959, pp. 160-61. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott The Tomb of the Kings") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, pp.45, 47. Rpt. ("Le Tombeau des rois") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, pp. 44, 46. Rpt. trans. Hlib Sirko/[...] in POESIE DU QUEBEC CONTEMPORAIN/ [...] Ed. Constantin Bida. Introd. Cecile Cloutier Wojciechowska. Etudes Slaves, No.2. Montreal: Librairie Dilom, 1968, pp. 39, 39, 41. Rpt. trans. Wolfram Burghardt/ [...] In POESIE/QUEBEC: DE SAINT-DE-NYS-GARNEAU A NOS JOURS/ [...] Ed. and preface Wolfram Burghardt/ [...] Montreal/ [...] 1972. pp. 39, 41. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott (revised -- "The Tomb of the Kings") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, pp.45, 47. Rpt. ("Le Tombeau des rois") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, pp.44, 46. Tr; TK ("Le Tombeau des rois/The Tomb of the Kings"); Poemes ("Le Tombeau des rois"); PAH ("Tomb of the Kings"); P[QRL] (revised -- "The Tomb of the Kings"). See B114 for the French anthology contributions in the 1968 book and B127 for the French anthology contributions in the 1972 book. See also B177 ("Le Tombeau des rois").

B36     "L'Envers du monde." Esprit, NS 20, Pt.2, No.10, [No.195] (oct. 1952), 445-46. Tr; TK ("L'Envers du monde/The Other Side of the World"); Poemes ("L'Envers du monde"); PAH ("The World's Other Side").

B37     "Naissance du pain." Esprit, NS 22, Pt. 2, No. 11, [No.220] (nov. 1954), 570-71. Rpt. trans. Maxine Kumin ("Bread is Born") in Massachusetts Review, 14 (Autumn 1973), 688-90. Poemes ("Naissance du pain"), PAH ("The Birth of Bread"); P[QRL] (revised).

B38     "Alchimie du jour." Esprit, NS 25, Pt.2, Nos.7-8, [No.252] (juil.-aofit 1957), 75-77. Poemes; PAH ("Alchemy of the Day"); P[QRL] (revised -- "The Alchemy of Day").

B39     "The Closed Room." Trans. F.R. Scott. The Tamarack Review, No. 7 (Spring 1958), pp.48-49. Rpt. ("La Chambre fermie") in StDenys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, pp.39, 41. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott (the Closed Room") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, pp.38, 40. Rpt. ("La Chambre fermie") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, pp. 38, 40. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott (revised -- "The Closed Room") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, pp.39, 41. Tr ("La Chambre fermie"); TK ("La Chambre fermie/ The Closed Room"); Poemes ("La Chambre fermie"); PAH ("The Closed Room"); P[QRL] (revised). See B187 ("La Chambre ferrule").

B40     "Je suis la terre et l'eau." Mercure de France [Paris], mai 1958, pp.19-20. Rpt. trans. Wolfram Burghardt/ [...] in POESIE/QUEBEC: DE SAINT-DENYS-GARNEAU A NOS JOURS / [...] Ed. and preface Wolfram Burghardt/ [...] 1972, p. 43. Rpt. trans. Valeria Pompejano ("Je suis la terre et l'eau/Io sono la terra e l'acqua") in Canadiana: Aspetti della storia e della letteratura canadese. Ed. Luca Codignola. Venice: Marsilio, 1978, pp.111-12. Poemes ("Je suis la terre et l'eau"); PAH ("I Am the Earth the Water"); P[QRL] (revised -- "I Am Earth and Water"). See B127 for the French contributions to the 1972 book.

B41     "Neige." Mercure de France [Paris], mai 1958, pp.19-20. Rpt. in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, p.48. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott ("Snow") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, p.49. ("Neige") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, p.48. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott (revised -- "Snow") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, p. 49. Poemes ("Neige"); PAH ("Snowy"). See B189 ("Neige").

B42     "Saison aveugle." Mercure de France [Paris], mai 1958, p. 21. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott ("Blind Season") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, p. 49. Rpt. ("Saison aveugle") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, p.48. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott (revised -- "Blind Season") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, p. 49. Rpt. ("Saison aveugle") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, p.48. Poemes; PAH ("Blind Season"); P[QRL] (revised).

B43     "Survienne la rose des vents." Mercure de France [Paris], mai 1958, pp.18-19. Poemes; PAH ("The Windrose Appears"); P[QRL] (revised -- "If the Windrose").

B44     "Les Mains." Trans. John Glassco. The Canadian Forum, Oct. 1959, p.160. Tr; TK ("Les Mains/The Hands"); Poemes ("Les Mains"); PAH ("Hands"); P[QRL] (revised).

B45     "Petit Desespoir" Trans. John Glassco. The Canadian Forum, Oct. 1959, p.160. Tr; TK ("Petit Disespoir/Little Despair"); Poemes ("Petit Disespoir'); PAH ("A Small Despair"); P[QRL] (revised -- "Minor Despair").

B46     "Et le jour fut." In Poetry 62. Ed. Eli Mandel and Jean-Guy Pilon. Toronto: Ryerson, 1961, pp. 8-9.

B47     "Il y a certainement quelqu'un." In St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, p.40. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott ("There Is Certainly Someone") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Marcotte. Vancouver: Klanak, 1962, p. 41. Rpt. trans. Hlib Sirko / [...] in POESIE DU QUEBEC CONTEMPORAIN / [...] Ed. Constantin Bida. Introd. Cecile Cloutier Wojciechowska. Etudes Slaves, No. 2. Montreal: Librairie Deom, 1968, p. 35. Rpt. ("Il y a certainement quelqu'un") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Mareotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, p. 40. Rpt. trans. Frank Scott (revised -- "There is Certainly Someone") in St-Denys Garneau & Anne Hebert. Preface Gilles Mareotte. Rev. ed. Vancouver: Klanak, 1978, p.41. Tr ("Il y a certainement quelqu'un"); TK ("Il y a certainement quelqu'un/There Is Certainly Someone"); Poemes ("Il y a certainement quelqu'un"); PAH ("There Is Surely Someone"); P[QRL] (revised -- "Surely Someone"). See B114 for the French anthology contributions in the 1968 book. See also B175 ("Il y a certainement quelqu'un").

B48     "Amour." In Litterature du Quebec. Ed. Guy Robert. Vol. I. Montreal: Deom, 1964, 57-58.

B49     "Fin du monde." In Litterature du Quebec. Ed. Guy Robert. Vol. I. Montreal: Deom, 1964, 61-63.

B50     "Noel." In Litterature du Quebec. Ed. Guy Robert. Vol. I. Montreal: Deom, 1964, 59-61.

B51     "Pluie." In Litterature du Quebec. Ed. Guy Robert. Vol. I. Montreal: Deom, 1964, 58-59.

B52     "Terre originelle." La Presse [Montreal], 13 fev. 1967, Sec. Cahier un siecle, p. 1.

B53     "A Little Dead Girl." Trans. Gwladys V. Downes. Edge, No. 7 (Winter 1967-68), p. 43. Tr ("Une petite morte"); TK ("Une petite morte/A Little Corpse"); Poemes ("Une petite morte"); PAH ("A Small Dead Girl"); P[QRL] (revised -- "Small Dead Girl").

B54     "The Planting of Hands." Trans. Gwladys V. Downes. Edge, No. 7 (Winter 1967-68), pp. 43-44. Rpt. trans. Wolfram Burghardt / [...] in POESIE/QUEBEC: DE SAINT-DENYS-GARNEAU A NOS JOURS / [...] Ed. and preface Wolfram Burghardt / Montreal / [...] 1972, p.37. Tr ("Nos mains au jardin"); TK ("Nos mains au jardin/Our Hands in the Garden"); Poemes ("Nos mains au jardin"); PAH ("Our Hands in the Garden"); P[QRL] (revised). See B127 for the French anthology contributions in the 1972 book. See also B184.

B55     "[...]" Trans. Hlib Sirko / [...] In POESIE DU QUEBEC CONTEMPORAIN / [...] Ed. Constantin Bida. Introd. Cecile Cloutier Wojciechowska, Etudes Slaves, No. 2. Montreal: Librairie Deom, 1968, pp.31, 33. Tr ("Vieille Image"); TK ("Vieille Image/Old Image"); Poemes ("Vieille Image"); PAH ("Dusty Image"); P[QRL] (revised -- "Old Picture"). See B114 for the French anthology contributions in the 1968 book.

B56     "Couronne de felicite." In Anne Hebert: une etude avec un choix de poemes, soixante illustrations, une chronique bibliographique: Anne Hebert et son temps. By Rene Lacote. Pontes d'aujourd'hui, No. 189. Paris: Seghers, 1969, p. 153.

B57     "Les Offenses." Poetry Australia [Sydney], No. 16 (June 1967), p. 41. Rpt. trans. Pasquale A. Jannini ("Les Offenses / Gli ofesi") in Canadiana: Aspetti della storia e della letteratura canadese. Ed. Luca Codignola. Venice: Marsilio, 1978, pp. 112-13.

B58     "Villes en marche." In Anne Hebert: une etude avec un choix de poemes, soixante illustrations, une chronique bibliographique: Anne Hebert et son temps. By Rene Lacote. Pontes d'aujourd'hui, No. 189. Paris: Seghers, 1969, p. 160.

B59     "Ena." Trans. Wolfram Burghardt/ [...] In POESIE / QUEBEC: DE SAINT-DENYS-GARNEAU A NOS JOURS / [...] Ed. and preface Wolfram Burghardt / [...]: Jour/ [...], 1972, pp. 45, 47. Poemes ("Eve [Reine et maitresse certaine crucifiee aux portes de la ville la plus lointaine...]"); PAH ("Eve [Queen and certain mistress crucified on the gates of the farthest city ...]"); P[QRL] (revised -- "Eve [Absolute queen and mistress crucified at the gates of the farthest city...]"). See B127 for the French anthology contributions in the 1972 book.

B60     "[...]." Trans. Wolfram Burghardt / [...] In POESIE / QUEBEC: DE SAINT-DENYS-GARNEAU A NOS JOURS / [...] Ed. and preface Wolfram Burghardt / [...] / [...] Jour / [...], 1972, p.35. Tr ("Nuit"); TK ("Nuit/Night"); Poemes ("Nuit"); PAH ("Night"); P [QRL]. See B127 for the French anthology contributions in the 1972 book.

B61     "[...]" Trans. Wolfram Burghardt / [...]. In POESIE / QUEBEC: DE SAINT-DENYS-GARNEAU A NOS JOURS / [...] Ed. and pre-face Wolfram Burghardt / [...]. Montreal / [...]: Jour / [...] 1972, pp. 29, 31, 33. Poemes ("Poesie, solitude rompue"); PAH ("Poetry Broken Solitude"). See B127 for the French anthology contributions in the 1972 book.

B62     "La Cigale." Chatelaine, dec. 1972, p. 22.

B63     "Eclair." Chatelaine, dec. 1972, p. 22.

B64     "En cas de malheur." Chatelaine, dec. 1972, p. 22.

B65     "Le jour n'a d'egal que la nuit." Quebec francais, No. 32 (dec. 1978), p. 41.

B66     "Memoire." Quebec francais, No.32 (dec. 1978), p. 35.

B67     "Mes enfants imaginaires." Quebec francais, No. 32 (dec. 1978), p. 41.

B68     "Sommeil." Quebec francais, No. 32 (dec. 1978), p. 34.

Database:
Canadian Literary Centre

Source: Part 1: Works By Anne Hebert. Russell, D.W. (compiler); Toronto, Ontario : ECW Press, 1987, pp. 117-145

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Contributions to periodicals and books (poems, short stories, excerpts and serials, reprinted anthology contributions: A selection, plays, essays, children's stories and plays, and journalism) and audio-visual material; Short stories  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

Short Stories

B69     "La Maison de l'esplanade." Amerique francaise, 3, No. 16 (sept. 1943), 38-47. Rpt. trans. Morna Scott Stoddart (expanded -- "The House on the Esplanade") in Queen's Quarterly, 60 (Summer 1953), pp.209-20. Rpt. trans. Armin Arnold and Christa Gollner ("Das Haus an der Esplande") in Moderne Erzcihler der Welt, 51: Kanada. Ed. Walter Riedel. Tubingen: Horst Erdmann Verlag, 1976, pp. 74-86. Tor. ("La Maison de l'esplande"); T:NSS ("The House on the Esplanade"). The 1943 publication is Part I of a two-part series. The reprints are the full story.

B70     "La Maison de l'esplanade." Amerique francaise, 3, No.17 (nov. 1943), 42-47. Rpt. trans. Morna Scott Stoddart (expanded -- "The House on the Esplanade") in Queen's Quarterly, 60 (Summer 1953), 209-20. Rpt. trans. Armin Arnold and Christa Gollner ("Das Haus an der Esplanade") in Moderne Erzahler der Welt, 51: Kanada. Ed. Walter Riedel. Tfibingen: Horst Erdmann Verlag, 1976, pp.74-86. Tor. ("La Maison de l'esplande"); T:NSS ("The House on the Esplande"). The 1943 publication is Part II of a two-part series. The reprints are the full story.

B71     "L'Ange de Dominique." Gants du ciel, No.9 (automne 1945), pp. 15-40. Tor.

B72     "Au bord du torrent." Amerique francaise, 7, No.2 (oct. 1947), 32-43. Rpt. trans. Renate Benson (revised -- "Der Wildbach") in Kanadische Erzahler der Gegenwart. Ed. Armin Arnold. Zurich: Manesse, 1967, pp.85-142. Tor. (revised -- "Le Torrent"); T:NSS ("The Torrent").

B73     "Shannon." Chatelaine, oct. 1960, pp. 34, 77-85. See B185.

B74     "Un grand mariage." Chatelaine, avril 1963, pp.30-31, 54-65. Rpt. trans. Thorgerd Schucker ("Die Einheirat") in Die Weite Reise: Kanadische Erzahlungen und Kurzgeschichten. Ed. Ernst Bartsch. Berlin: Verlag Volk und Welt, 1974, pp. 181-211. Tor.; T:NSS ("A Grand Marriage").

B75     "Un dimanche a la campagne." Chatelaine, sept. 1966, pp. 38,125-27,137-51.

B76     "Le Silence." Le Figaro litteraire, 10 jan. 1971, pp. 23-25.

B77     "Le Livre de Eva Perkins, printemps 1936, extrait." Liberte, 25, No. 1 [No.145] (fev. 1983), 51-53.

Database:
Canadian Literary Centre

Source: Part 1: Works By Anne Hebert. Russell, D.W. (compiler); Toronto, Ontario : ECW Press, 1987, pp. 117-145

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Contributions to periodicals and books (poems, short stories, excerpts and serials, reprinted anthology contributions: A selection, plays, essays, children's stories and plays, and journalism) and audio-visual material; Excerpts and serials  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

Excerpts and Serials

B78     Kamouraska (excerpts). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, 26 April 1972, p. 31; 27 April 1972, p.21; 28 April 1972, p.31. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments from 26 April to 29 June 1972. See B79-B96.

B79     Kamouraska (excerpt). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Bilder und Zeiten [Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung], 29 April 1972, p. [4]. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78 and B80-B96.

B80     Kamouraska (excerpts). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, 2 May 1972, p. 21; 3 May 1972, p. 31; 4 May 1972, p. 27; 5 May 1972, p. 31. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B79 and B81-B96.

B81     Kamouraska (excerpt). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Bilder und Zeiten [Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung], 6 May 1972, p. [4]. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B80 and B82-B96.

B82     Kamouraska (excerpts). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, 8 May 1972, p.21; 9 May 1972, p.21; 10 May 1972, p.31; 12 May 1972, p. 27. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B81 and B83-B96.

B83     Kamouraska (excerpt). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Bilder und Zeiten [Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung], 13 May 1972, p. [4]. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B82 and B84-B96.

B84     Kamouraska (excerpts). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, 15 May 1972, p.19; 16 May 1972, p.23; 17 May 1972, p.31; 18 May 1972, p. 27; 19 May 1972, p. 31. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B83 and B85-B96.

B85     Kamouraska (excerpt). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Bilder und Zeiten [Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung], 20 May 1972, p. [4]. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B84 and B86-B96.

B86     Kamouraska (excerpts). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, 23 May 1972, p. 23; 24 May 1972, p.31; 25 May 1972, p.23; 26 May 1972, p. 31. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B85 and B87-B96.

B87     Kamouraska (excerpt). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Bilder und Zeitung [Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung], 27 May 1972, p. [4]. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B86 and B88-B96.

B88     Kamouraska (excerpts). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Frankfurter AUgemeine Zeitung, 29 May 1972, p.23; 30 May 1972, p.21; 31 May 1972, p.31:2 June 1972, p. 31. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B87 and B89-B96.

B89     Kamouraska (excerpt). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Bilder und Zeiten [Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeiten], 3 June 1972, p. [4]. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B88 and B90-B96.

B90     Kamouraska (excerpts). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, 5 June 1972, p. 17; 6 June 1972, p.21; 7 June 1972, p.31; 8 June 1972, p. 23; 9 June 1972, p. 31. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B89 and B91-B96.

B91     Kamouraska (excerpt). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Bilder und Zeiten [Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung], 10 June 1972, p. [4]. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B90 and B92-B96.

B92     Kamouraska (excerpts). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, 12 June 1972, p. 19; 13 June 1972, p.19; 14 June 1972, p.31; 15 June 1972, p. 27. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B91 and B93-B96.

B93     Kamouraska (excerpt). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Bilder und Zeiten [Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung], 16 June 1972, p. [4]. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B92 and B94-B96.

B94     Kamouraska (excerpts). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, 19 June 1972, p. 23; 20 June 1972, p. 23; 21 June 1972, p. 31; 22 June 1972, p. 21; 23 June 1972, p. 27. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B93 and B95-B96.

B95     Kamouraska (excerpt). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Bilder und Zeiten [Frankfurter Allgemein Zeitung], 24 June 1972, p. [4]. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B94 and B96.

B96     Kamouraska (excerpts). Trans. Gertrud Strub. Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, 26 June 1972, p. 19; 27 June 1972, p. 19; 28 June 1972, p. 31; 29 June 1972, p. 21. Kam. Serialized in 51 installments. See B78-B95.

B97     "L'Appartement" Etudes litteraires [Univ. de Laval], 12 (dec. 1979), 403-05. Hel. (revised -- "L'Appartement").

B98     "Les Fous de Bassan. Le livre du reverend Nicolas Jones, autumn 1982." Actualite, oct. 1982, pp. 72-74, 76, 78, 80-81. FB (expanded-"Le Livre du reverend Nicolas Jones").

B99     The Guests on Trial:A Dramatic Poem for Radio (to my brother Pierre). Trans. Eugene Benson and Renate Benson. Canadian Drama/L'Art dramatique canadien [Univ. of Waterloo], 9 ([Spring] 1983), 165-94. Ts.Ma.Ip (Les Invites au proces).

Title:

Database:
Canadian Literary Centre

Source: Part 1: Works By Anne Hebert. Russell, D.W. (compiler); Toronto, Ontario : ECW Press, 1987, pp. 117-145

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Contributions to periodicals and books (poems, short stories, excerpts and serials, reprinted anthology contributions: A selection, plays, essays, children's stories and plays, and journalism) and audio-visual material; Reprinted anthology contributions: A selection  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

Reprinted Anthology Contributions: A Selection

B100     "The House on the Esplanade." Trans. Morna Scott Stoddart. In The Best American Short Stories 1954. Ed. and foreword Martha Foley. Boston: Houghton Mifflin, 1954, pp. 163-73.

B101     "La Chambre de bois," "En guise de fete," "Les Mains," "Nuit," "Petit Desespoir," "Le Tombeau des rois," and "Un bruit de soie." In L'Ame de la poesie canadienne-francaise Ed. and preface Laure Rinse. Toronto: Macmillan, 1955, pp. 255-63.

B102     "Ballade d'un enfant qui va mourir," "La Chambre fermee," "Les Deux Mains," "Eve [Reine et maitresse certaine crucifee aux portes de la ville la plus lointaine ...]," "La Fille maigre," "Marine," "Musique," and "Le Tombeau des rois." In Anthologie de la poesie canadienne-francaise. 2nd ed. Ed. and introd. Guy Sylvestre. Montreal: Beauchemin, 1958, pp. 222-34.

B103     "La Fille maigre/The Thin Girl," "Les Grandes Fontaines/Deep Fountains," and "Un mur peine/Not Quite a Wail." Trans. G.R. Roy. In Douze pontes modernes du Canada francais/ Twelve Modern French Canadian Poets. Ed. and preface G.R. Roy. Toronto: Ryerson, 1958, pp. 60-67.

B104     "Ballade d'un enfant qui va mourir," "La Chambre fermee," "Les Deux Mains," "Le Tombeau des rois," and "Vie de chateau." In The Oxford Book of Canadian Verse: In English and French. Ed. and introd. A.J.M. Smith. Toronto: Oxford Univ. Press, 1960, pp. 328-37.

B105     "En guise de fete," "Je suis la terre et l'eau," "Il y a certainement quelqu'un," "Nos mains au jardin," and "La Voix de l'oiseau." In La poesie canadienne. Ed. and introd. Alain Bosquet. Paris: Seghers; Montreal: HMH, 1962, pp. 75-82.

B106     "Amour," "Fin du monde," "Noel," "Poesie, solitude rompue" (essay), and "Pluie." In Temoignages de pontes. Vol. 1 of Litterature du Quebec. Ed. and introd. Guy Robert. Montreal: Librairie Deom, 1964, pp. 57-67.

B107     "Amour," "Ballade d'un enfant qui va mourir," "Catherine, Michel et Lia" (excerpt from Les Chambres de bois), "La Chambre fermee," "Des dieux captifs," "Eve [Commencement du monde.]," "Fin du monde," "L'Infante ne danse plus," "Instant," "Mystere de la parole," "Neige," "Noel," "Nuit," "Le Pays de Catherine" (excerpt from Les Chambres de bois), "Pluie," "Presence," Le Temps sauvage (excerpts), "Le Tombeau des rois," and "Le Torrent" (excerpts). In Anne Hebert. By Pierre Page. Ecrivains canadiens d'aujourd'hui. Montreal: Fides, 1965, pp. 123-70.

B108     "Elle est assise au bord des saisons," "En guise de fete," "Une petite morte," "La sagesse m'a rompu les bras," "Le Tombeau des rois," and "Un bruit de soie." In La Poesie francaise de Baudelaire a nos jours. Vol. II of Une Anthologie vivante de la litterature d'aujourd'hui. Ed., avertissement, and introd. Pierre de Boisdeffre. Paris: Perrin, 1966, pp. 720-28.

B109     "En guise de fete," "Je suis la terre et l'eau," "II y a certainement quelqu'un," "Nos mains au jardin," and "La Voix de l'oiseau." In Poesie du Quebec. Ed. and introd. Alain Bosquet. Paris: Seghers; Montreal: HMH, 1966, pp. 79-86.

B110     "La Chambre fermee," "Eve [Reine et maitresse, certaine crucifiee aux portes de la ville la plus lointaine...]," "La Fille maigre," "Mystere de la parole," "Le Tombeau des rois," and "Vie de chateau." In Modern Canadian Verse: In English and French. Ed. and preface A.J.M. Smith. Toronto: Oxford Univ. Press, 1967, pp. 187-94.

B111     "Mystere de la parole," "Le Tombeau des rois," and "Le Torrent" (excerpt). In A Century of Canadian Literature/Un Siecle de litterature canadienne. Ed. and preface H. Gordon Green and Guy Sylvestre. Montreal: HMH; Toronto: Ryerson, 1967, pp. 382-86, 537-40.

B112     "Quand il est question de nommer la vie tout court, nous ne pouvons que balbutier" (essay). In Quebec: hier et aujourd'hui. Ed. and introd. Laurier LaPierre. Preface Jean Lesage. Toronto: Macmillan, 1967, pp. 278-81.

B113     "La Chambre de bois," "Eveil au seuil d'une fontaine," "Mystere de la parole," "Nuit," "Paysage," "Petit Desespoir" and "Saison aveugle." In Recueil de textes litteraires canadiens-francais. Ed. and preface Andre Renaud. Montreal: Renouveau pedagogique, 1968, pp. 182-86.

B114     "Il y a certainement quelqu'un," "Le Tombeau des rois," and "Vieille Image." In POESIE DU QUEBEC CONTEMPORAIN / [...] Trans. Hlib Sirko / [...]. Ed. Constantin Bida. Introd. Cecile Cloutier Wojciechowska. Etudes Slaves, No. 2. Montreal: Librairie Deom, 1968, pp. 30, 32, 34, 36, 38, 40. See B35, B47, and B55 for the Russian translations in this volume.

B115     "Le Miroir," "Mystere de la parole," "Nos mains au jardin," "Quand il est question de nommer la vie tout court, nous ne pouvons que balbutier" (essay) (excerpt), "La sagesse m'a rompu les bras," "Le Tombeau des rois," "Le Torrent" (excerpt), and "La Voix de l'oiseau." In Histoire de la litterature canadienne-francaise par les textes: Des origines a nos jours. Ed. and preface Gerard Bessette, Lucien Geslin, and Charles Parent. Montreal: Centre Educatif et culturel, 1968, pp. 261-70.

B116     "Amour, "Ballade d'un enfant qui va mourir," "La Chambre de bois," "La Chambre fermee," "En guise de fete," "Et le jour fur," "Eve [Commencement du monde...]," "Eve [Reine et maitresse certaine crucifee aux portes de la ville la plus lointaine...]," "La Fille maigre," "Fin du monde," "Les Grandes Fontaines," "I1 y a certainement quelqu'un," "L'Infante ne danse plus," "Je suis la terre et l'eau," "Ma douleur," "Mystere de la parole," "Neige," "Noel," "Nos mains au jardin," "Les Offenses," "Les Pecheurs d'eau," "Pluie," "Poesie, solitude rompue" (essay), "Presence," "Printemps sur la ville," "Retourne sur tes pas," "La sagesse m'a rompu les bras," "Saint-Denys Garneau" (film script), "Saison aveugle," "Survienne la rose des vents," "Terre originelle," "Le Tombeau des rois," "Un bruit de soie," and "Vie de chateau." In Anne Hebert: une etude avec un choix de poemes, soixante illustrations, une chronique bibliographique: Anne Hebert et son temps. By Rene Lacote. Pontes d'aujourd'hui, No.189. Paris: Seghers, 1969, pp. 94-152,154-59,161,163-64.

B117     "Ballade d'un enfant qui va mourir," "La Chambre de bois," "Les Deux Mains," "Nuit," "La sagesse m'a rompu les bras," and "Le Tombeau des rois." In Pontes du Quebec 1860-1968. Ed. and preface Jacques Cotnam. Montreal: Fides, 1969, pp. 110-21.

B118     "En guise de fete," "Les Mains," "Marine," "Musique" "Presence," "Nuit," and "La Voix de l'oiseau." In Poesie de la France et du Canada francais. Ed. and introd. Karl L. Weber, Ramon J. Hathorn, and Neal R. Johnson. Toronto: Longmans, 1969, pp. 337-44.

B119     "La Fille maigre" and "Le Tombeau des rois." Ed. and introd. Pierre de Grandpre. In 1945 & nos jours -- la poesie. Vol. III of Histoire de la litterature francaise du Quebec. Montreal: Beauchemin, 1969, pp. 50-53.

B120     "Cities in Sail," "The Closed Room," "The Lean Girl," "A Little Dead Girl," "The Little Towns," "Manor Life," "The Planting of Hands," "Snow," "There Is Certainly Someone," "The Tomb of the Kings," "A Touch of Despair," "The Two Hands," and "Under the Rain." Trans. G.V. Downes, John Glassco, Ralph Gustafson, and F.R. Scott. In The Poetry of French Canada in Translation. Ed. and introd. John Glassco. Toronto: Oxford Univ. Press, 1970, pp. 131-44.

B121     "Eve [Queen and undoubted lady at the farthest city's gates...]" and "Offended Parties." In One Hundred Poems of Modern Quebec. Ed. and trans. Fred Cogswell. Fredericton,              N.B.: Fiddlehead Poetry Books, 1970, pp. 26-27.

B122     "The House on the Esplanade." Trans. Morna Scott Stoddart. In The Story-Makers: A Selection of Modern Short Stories. Ed. and introd. Rudy Wiebe. Toronto: Macmillan, 1970, pp. 172-83.

B123     "Manor Life." Trans. F.R. Scott. In Canadian Writing Today. Ed. and introd. Mordecai Richler. Harmondsworth, Eng.: Penguin, 1970, p.43.

B124     "And It Was Day," "Captive Gods," "Night," "Snow," and "Wisdom Broke My Arm." In A Second Hundred Poems of Modern Quebec. Ed. and trans. Fred Cogswell. Fredericton, N.B.: Fiddlehead Poetry Books, 1971, pp. 4-8.

B125     "Les Grandes Fontaines" "Mystere de la parole," and "Le Torrent" [excerpt]. In Anthologie de la litterature de l'Amerique francophone. Ed. and preface Auguste Viatte. Sherbrooke: CELEF, 1971, pp. 157-60.

B126     "The House on the Esplanade." In Great Canadian Short Stories. Ed. and introd. Alec Lucas. New York: Dell, 1971, pp. 167-77.

B127     "Eve [Reine et maitresse certaine crucifiee aux portes de la ville la plus lointaine...]," "Je suis la terre et l'eau ...," "Nos mains au jardin," "Nuit," "Poesie, solitude rompue" (essay), and "Le Tombeau des rois." In POESIE/QUEBEC: DE SAINT-DENYS-GARNEAU A NOS JOURS / [...] Ed. and preface Wolfram Burghardt / [...]. Montreal / [...] 1972, pp. 28, 30, 32, 34, 36, 38, 40, 42, 44, 46. See B35, B40, B54, B59-B61 for the Ukrainian translations of these texts.

B128     "The Little Towns," "Manor Life," and "The Tomb of the Kings." Trans. John Glassco and F.R. Scott. In The Oxford Anthology of Canadian Literature. Ed. and preface Robert Weaver and William Toye. Toronto: Oxford Univ. Press, 1973, pp. 206-09.

B129     "Printemps sur la ville" and "Retourne sur tes pas." In La Poesie francaise: des origines a nos jours. Ed. and preface Claude Bonnefoy. Paris: Seuil, 1975, pp. 552-53.

B130     "And It Was Day," "Captive Gods," "Eve [Queen and undoubted lady crucified ...]," "Night," "Our Hands in the Garden," "Snow," and "Wisdom Broke My Arm." In Poetry of Modern Quebec. Ed., trans., and preface Fred Cogswell. Montreal: Harvest House, 1976, pp. 53-62.

B131     "The Coral Frock," trans. Gwendolyn Moore (excerpt), and Kamouraska, trans. Norman Shapiro (excerpt). In Women in Canadian Literature. Ed. and introd. M.G. Hesse. Ottawa: Borealis, 1976, pp. 74-79,201-09.

B132     "Eve [Queen, mistress, crucified at the gates of the farthest city ...]," "Landscape," "Night," and "Wisdom Has Broken My Arms." Trans. Kathleen Weaver. In The Other Voice: TwentiethCentury Women's Poetry in Translation. Ed. and introd. Joanna Bankier, Carol Cosman, Doris Earnshaw, Joan Keefe, Deirdre Lashgari, and Kathleen Weaver. Foreword Adrienne Rich. New York: Norton, 1976, pp. 9-11, 81-82, 117-18.

B133     "As if for a Holiday," "Blind Season," "The Closed Room," "The Lean Girl," "Manor Life," "Snow" "There Is Certainly Someone," "The Tomb of the Kings," and "The Two Hands." In Poems of French Canada. Ed., trans., and preface Frank R. Scott. Burnaby, B.C.: Blackfish, 1977, pp. 23-37.

B134     "A Grand Marriage." Trans. Gwendolyn Moore. In The Best Modern Canadian Short Stories. Ed. and introd. Ivon Owen and Morris Wolfe. Edmonton: Hurtig, 1978, pp. 268-85.

B135     "The Lean Girl," "Life in the Castle," "The Little Towns," "Snow," "Spring Over the City," "The Tomb of the Kings," "The Water Fisherman," and "The Wooden Room." Trans. Alan Brown, John Glassco, Peter Miller, and F.R. Scott. In Literature in Canada. Ed. and preface Douglas Daymond and Leslie Monkman. Vol.II. Toronto: Gage, 1978, 318-25.

B136     "A Little Dead Girl" and "The Planting of Hands." Trans. Gwladys Downes. In Out of the Violent Dark. By Gwladys Downes. Victoria, B.C.: Sono Nis, 1978, pp. 148-49.

B137     "Spring over the City" and "The Tomb of Kings." Trans. Kathleen Weaver. In The Penguin Book of Women Poets. Ed. and preface Carol Cosman, Joan Keefe, and Kathleen Weaver. London: Allen Lane, 1978, pp. 356-59.

B138     Kamouraska (excerpt). In Le Quebec par ses textes litteraires (1954-1976). Ed. and preface Michel LeBel and Jean-Marcel Paquette. Ottawa/Montreal: Fernand Nathan/France-Quebec, 1979, pp. 316-17.

B139     "The Alchemy of Day," "Bread Is Born," "Crown of Happiness" "The Great Fountains," "Life in the Castle," 'The Offended," "Our Hands in the Garden," "The Skinny Girl," and "The Tomb of the Kings." Trans. Aliki Barnstone, Willis Barnstone, Maxime Kumin, and A. Poulin, Jr. In A Book of Women Poets from Antiquity to Now. Ed. Aliki Barnstone and Willis Barnstone. New York: Schocken, 1980, pp. 229-40.

B140     "Alchimie du jour," "La Chambre de bois," "La Chambre fermee," Les Chambres de bois (excerpt), "Des dieux captifs," "L'Envers du monde," "Eve [Reine et maitresse certaine crucifiee aux portes de la ville la plus lointaine ...]," "Eveil au seuil d'une fontaine," "La Fille maigre," Kamouraska (excerpt), "Mystere de la parole," "Poesie, solitude rompue" (essay), "Saison aveugle," "Sous la pluie" (from Les Songes en equilibre), "Sous la pluie" (from Le Tombeau des rois), "Le Tombeau des rois," and "Le Torrent" (excerpt). In L'Age de l'interrogation. Vol. IV of Anthologie de la litterature quebecoise. Ed. and introd. Rene Dionne and Gabrielle Poulin. Montreal: La Presse, 1980, pp. 194-226.

B141     "Eve [Reine et maitresse certaine crucifiee aux portes de la ville la plus lointaine...]," "Eveil au seuil d'une fontaine," "La Fille maigre," "Je suis la terre et l'eau," "Neige," "Nos mains au jardin," "La sagesse m'a rompu les bras," "Le Tombeau des rois," and "Une petite morte." In La Poesie quebecoise des origines a nos jours. Ed. and introd. Laurent Mailhot and Pierre Nepveau. Quebec/Montreal: Les Presses de l'Univ, du Quebec/l'Hexagone, 1980, pp. 278-88.

B142     "The Torrent." Trans. Gwendolyn Moore. In The Penguin Book of Modern Canadian Short Stories. Ed. and preface Wayne Grady. Harmondsworth, Eng.: Penguin, 1982, pp. 3-32.

B143     "The Torrent." Trans. Gwendolyn Moore. In The Oxford Book of French-Canadian Short Stories. Ed. Richard Teleky. Introd. Marie-Claire Blais. Toronto: Oxford Univ. Press, 1983, pp. 115-51.

B144     "The House on the Esplanade." Trans. Morna Scott Stoddart. In Stories by Canadian Women. Ed. and introd. Rosemary Sullivan. Toronto: Oxford Univ. Press, 1984, pp. 122-31.

Source: Part 1: Works By Anne Hebert. Russell, D.W. (compiler); Toronto, Ontario : ECW Press, 1987, pp. 117-145

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Contributions to periodicals and books (poems, short stories, excerpts and serials, reprinted anthology contributions: A selection, plays, essays, children's stories and plays, and journalism) and audio-visual material; Plays  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

Plays

B145     La Merciere assassinee. Ecrits du Canada francais, 4 (1958), 17-112. Rpt. trans. Eugene Benson and Renate Benson (The Murdered Shopkeeper) in Canadian Drama/L'Art dramatique canadien [Univ. of Waterloo], 10 (Fall/ automne 1984), 232-96. Ts.Ma.Ip (revised). See B179-B182.

B146     Le Temps sauvage. Ecrits du Canada francais, 16 (1963), 9-108. Ts.Ma.Ip (revised).

B147     I'Ile de la demoiselle. Ecrits du Canada francais, 42 (1979), 9-92.

Canadian Literary Centre

Source: Part 1: Works By Anne Hebert. Russell, D.W. (compiler); Toronto, Ontario : ECW Press, 1987, pp. 117-145

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Contributions to periodicals and books (poems, short stories, excerpts and serials, reprinted anthology contributions: A selection, plays, essays, children's stories and plays, and journalism) and audio-visual material; Essays  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

Essays

B148     "De Saint-Denys Garneau et le paysage." La Nouvelle Relive, 3 (dec. 1944), 523.

B149     "L'Annonce faite a Marie." La Revue dominicaine, jan. 1945, pp. 3-7.

B150     "Voici notre jeune litterature: Robert Charbonneau." La Revue populaire, oct. 1946, pp.13, 73.

B151     "La Critique en proces." Le Devoir [Montreal], 12 mai 1951, p. 8.

B152     Hebert, Anne, and Frank Scott. "La Traduction: dialogue entre le traducteur et l'auteur." Introd. Jeanne Lapointe. Ecrits du Canada francais, 7 (1960), 193-236. Rpt. trans. F.R. Scott, (excerpts

         Hebert, Anne, and Frank Scott. "The Art of Translation: Dialogue between F.R. Scott and Anne Hebert") in The Tamarack Review, No.24 (Summer 1962), pp.65-90. Dst ("Dialogue").

B153     "Quand il est question de nommer la vie tout court, nous ne pouvons que balbutier." Le Devoir [Montreal], 22 oct. 1960, Supp. litteraire, p.9. Rpt. ("Plaidoyer d'Anne Hebert") in Jeunesses litteraires du Canada francais, 3, No. 3 (fev. 1966), 10.

B154     "Le Quebec, cette aventure demesuree." La Presse [Montreal], 13 fev. 1967, Sec. Cahier un siecle, pp. 16-17.

B155     "Les Etes de Kamouraska ... et les hivers de Quebec." Le Devoir [Montreal], 28 oct. 1972, Supp. litteraire, p. 7. Rpt. trans. ("Der Duft des Regens im Sommer von Kamouraska") in Merian [Hamburg, W. Ger.], May 1978, pp. 102-06.

B156     "Un regard ironique ..." In Jean-Paul Lemieux, peintre quebecois. Preface Jacques Lassaigne. Paris: Musee d'art moderne de la ville de Paris, [1974], pp.[3-5]. Rpt. Quebec: Ministere des Affaires Culturelles du Quebec, [1974], pp. 10-11.

B157     "Mort coeur sauvage, je le dis en francais." Les Nouvelles litteraires [Paris], 29 jan. 1976, p. 22.

B158     "Ecrire pour moi ..." Ecrits du Canada francais, 54 (1985), 5-8.

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Contributions to periodicals and books (poems, short stories, excerpts and serials, reprinted anthology contributions: A selection, plays, essays, children's stories and plays, and journalism) and audio-visual material; Children's stories and plays  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

Children's Stories and Plays

B159     "Trois petits garcons dans Bethleem: Conte de Noel." Le Canada francais, 25 (dec. 1937), 395-97.

B160     "Enfants a la fenetre: Theatre." Le Canada francais, 25 (avril 1938), 822-25.

B161     "La Part de Suzanne: Conte de Noel." Le Canada francais, 26 (dec. 1938), 348-52.

B162     "La Boutique de Monsieur Grinsec. Feerie de Noel en un acte et trois tableaux." L'Action catholique [Montreal], 5 jan. 1941, Supp. des dimanches, pp. 4, 10. Part 1 of a three-part series.

B163     "La Boutique de Monsieur Grinsec. Feerie de Noel en un acte et trois tableaux." L'Action catholique [Montreal], 12 jan. 1941, Supp. des dimanches, p. 4. Part II of a three-part series.

B164     "La Boutique de Monsieur Grinsec. Feerie de Noel en un acte et trois tableaux." L'Action catholique [Montreal], 19 jan. 1941, Supp. des dimanches, pp. 4, 10. Part III of a three-part series.

Part 1 Works by Anne Hébert; Contributions to periodicals and books (poems, short stories, excerpts and serials, reprinted anthology contributions: A selection, plays, essays, children's stories and plays, and journalism) and audio-visual material; Journalism  

Russell, D.W. (compiler)

Journalism

B165     "Anne Hebert a Paris: Albee, Godard, Varda." Le Magazine Maclean, mai 1965, p. 93.

B166     "Anne Hebert a Paris: 'La guerre civile' et 'De l'amour.'" Le Magazine Maclean, juin 1965, p.63.

B167     "Anne Hebert a Paris: Cinema." Le Magazine Maclean, juil. 1965, p. 47.

B168     "Anne Hebert a Paris: Le Royaume de Madame Metrot." Le Magazine Maclean, aout 1965, p. 46.

B169     "Anne Hebert: Une villa au coeur de Paris." Le Magazine Maclean, sept. 1965, p. 61.

B170     "Anne Hebert h Paris: Deux dames en noir." Le Magazine Maclean, oct. 1965, p. 71.

B171     "Le Billet d'Anne Hebert: Voix seche de la Provence en appel." Le Magazine Maclean, nov. 1965, p. 93.

B172     "Le Billet d'Anne Hebert: Sagan, Moreau... et Ingmar Bergman." Le Magazine Maclean, dec. 1965, p. 66.

B173     "Le Billet d'Anne Hebert: Albertine Sarrazine, ecrivain-vedette." Le Magazine Maclean, jan. 1966, p. 47.
